definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: After the rain is fine, Lotus overflowing, success and fame only in overnight.
sentences.chinese: 雨過是天晴，荷香四溢，成功與英名只在朝夕間。

sentences.english: Life is for one generation; a good name is forever.
sentences.chinese: 生命只有一代之久，英名千古長存。

sentences.english: How much blood and sweat dedication, but not French law of England.
sentences.chinese: 奉獻幾多血和汗，不求青史留英名。

sentences.english: Some day all progressive mankind will cherish his memory .
sentences.chinese: 有一天整個進步的人類都會敬仰他的英名。

sentences.english: Non-current disgrace Jun Changsha far, Mo removal fame negative Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 長沙流謫君非遠，莫遣英名負洛陽。

sentences.english: Later, Han Xin became a general of Han Dynasty and achieved fame.
sentences.chinese: 後來，韓信成爲漢朝大將，成就了一代英名。

sentences.english: The Douglas dead, his name hath won the field.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯雖然死了，但他的英名卻爲他贏得了戰鬥。

sentences.english: I am sure he keeps nothing from me but this .
sentences.chinese: 我知道上帝有他英名的用意。

definition: to have one's name go down in history as a byword for infamy (idiom)
lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
lit. although dead, also honored; died a glorious death
